title: Average annual wages in Italy 2000 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual wages in euros, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2012.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2007 to 2003.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2010 to 2007.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2003 to 2000.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2018 to 2016.
But, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2012 to 2010.
gold: Between 2000 and 2018 , the average wage in Italy was stable , remaining between 29 thousand and 30 thousand euros . In 2018 , male managers represented the group of people with the highest earnings . Their gross salary amounted to 102 thousand euros a year .
